Collage of AI, First Term Â  (2025 - 2026)

The human brainâ€™s trillion-synapse architecture dwarfs even ChatGPTâ€™s 175 billion parameters in complexity. How does such a biological network generate intelligence, and what can it teach us about Artificial General Intelligence (AGI)? This course â€œNeuroAI: From Brain Science to Brain-Inspired Intelligenceâ€ investigates the cutting-edge intersection between neural computation and bio-inspired AI. Starting with neuronal models and neural coding principles, it systematically explores biological mechanisms in sensory systems and higher cognition, while emphasizing their translation into brain-inspired algorithms like spiking neural networks and memory models. Through lectures, computational tools, and critical discussions, students will master methodologies bridging biological and artificial intelligence, laying foundations for AGI research. Designed for advanced students with mathematical/programming backgrounds who are passionate about neuroscience-AI integration.

  • Week 1: What is NeuroAI?
  • Week 2: What is the similarity and connection between brain and AI?

Climate Learning Programme

Imperial College Business School x CMA CGM - TANGRAM Â  (2024 - Present)

This bespoke Executive Education programme has been offered to CMA CGM employees at the TANGRAM facility in Marseille. Over 1000 attendees have attended the programme to-date over multiple cohorts.

We led the delivery of the Sustainable Shipping segment, offering an overview of the policy landscapes, technological initiatives to support decarbonisation. A deep dive is offered on operational measures that reduce emissions and improve operational efficiency.
